frameworks.name: System.Messaging
frameworks.notes: MSMQ message queuing - Windows-only, deprecated technology

legacyPatterns.description: Application uses Windows-specific ServiceBase class for service hosting
Uses Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ), a legacy Windows-only messaging system
legacyPatterns.modernAlternative: Azure Service Bus, Azure Storage Queues, RabbitMQ, or other cloud-native messaging

legacyPatterns.description: Uses legacy .csproj format with ToolsVersion and verbose XML
Uses App.config for configuration instead of modern configuration patterns
Uses separate AssemblyInfo.cs file for assembly metadata
Uses legacy Windows Service installer infrastructure
legacyPatterns.modernAlternative: Container-based deployment or Windows Service with modern hosting

legacyPatterns.description: Uses Console.WriteLine for logging instead of structured logging

blockers: MSMQ is Windows-only and not available in containers

complexity.reasoning: High complexity due to: 1) Major framework upgrade (.NET Framework 4.8.1 to .NET 10), 2) Complete architecture change (Windows Service to Worker Service/Container), 3) Replace MSMQ with modern messaging, 4) Project format modernization, 5) Platform shift (Windows-only to cross-platform/containerized). Medium-sized codebase with straightforward business logic reduces complexity slightly.

estimatedEffort.description: Medium-high effort requiring architectural changes and messaging system replacement

phases.name: Architecture Modernization
phases.description: Replace Windows Service with Worker Service

phases.name: Messaging Modernization
tasks: Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus

phases.name: Containerization
phases.description: Add Docker support and Azure Container Apps deployment
tasks: Create Azure Container Apps deployment configuration

risks.mitigation: May need message format conversion or migration tooling to move messages from MSMQ to Azure Service Bus
Review breaking changes documentation and test thoroughly
Document queue naming conventions and update all dependent systems
Team needs training on container deployment and Azure Service Bus management

benefits: Cloud-native architecture suitable for Azure Container Apps
Modern hosting patterns with better lifecycle management
Active framework support and security updates
Reduced infrastructure costs (no Windows licensing for containers)
Better development experience with modern tooling
nextSteps: Set up development environment with .NET 10 SDK
Create Azure Service Bus namespace for development
Set up CI/CD pipeline for containerized deployment
Plan message migration strategy from MSMQ to Service Bus
